Your responsibility ends at filing the DIR at the nearest police station - you will not be hassled for any further info #PWDVA #preventingDV
Once the DIR is filed, the protection officer takes up the case with the individual on whose behalf it is filed. #PWDVA #preventingDV
Women are often not keen on filing a DIR themselves, but anyone else aware of the situation can do it on their behalf #PWDVA #preventingDV
If you feel the life of another person is under threat due to #domesticviolence, you can file a case on their behalf. #preventingDV #PWDVA
The PWDVA allows you to file a case independently without seeking the aid of your family. @BPiali
...and the case hearing needs to be completed and an order passed in 60 days #PWDVA #preventingDV
Also, bear in mind the #PWDVA comes with a time provision - the first hearing must come within three days of filing a case.
Under the #PWDVA you are also entitled to custody of your children and free or pro-bono legal aid. #preventingDV
..without fear of eviction OR the threat of violence #PWDVA #preventingDV
As a Civil Law, the #PWDVA may not put offender behind bars, but it ensures the woman can stay in the same house as her husband or family...
Urvashi points out the #PWDVA contains provisions within it for most of the fears faced by women looking to escape a DV situ #preventingDV

Compensation under the PWDVA Act.

PWDVA is a civil law. It does not look at punitive measures or criminal reparations. But it looks at providing relief to the victims through court appointed protection officers. It expands the definition of abuse also from merely physical to include other aspects like emotional.
Under the PWDVA, it includes civil unions, married couples, basically anyone living in a domestic relationship.
